availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph S. Burdett (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer, newspaper editor, and notary public)

body.p: Garrard and Pulaski County, Kentucky, farm laborer, newspaper editor, and notary public. Kentucky native. Son of Enoch Burdett. Attended Kentucky University in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1859. Farm laborer in Garrard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1850. Newspaper editor in Pulaski County in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Pulaski County in 1860. Notary public in Garrard County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 1, p. 230A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, District 1, p. 151.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, District 1, p. 195A.
First Annual Announcement of Kentucky University, 1859 (Louisville: Morton & Griswold, 1859), 30.
"Joseph Smith Burdett (1834-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial 7221931, accessed October 1, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7221931.
